text: The Dalmatian pelican (Pelecanus crispus) is a large bird. It lives in wet places such as in swamps and shallow lakes. It can be found from southeastern Europe to Pakistan and China. It is the largest member of the pelican family. The average length is 170–190 cm (67-75 inches) The average weight is 11–15 kg (24-33 lbs). The wings are around 3 m (10 ft) across. It is the world's heaviest flying bird on average. However, sometimes a few birds from another species may also be as large or larger.del Hoyo et al 1992. Handbook of the Birds of the World. Volume 1: Ostrich to Ducks. Lynx Edicions. John B. Dunning Jr. (ed) 1992. CRC handbook of avian body masses. CRC Press. . ==References== Category:Pelecaniformes Category:Birds of Asia Category:Birds of Europe
title: Dalmatian pelican
